channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Windows 10 users face ransomware nightmare as Microsoft support ends in 2025 worldwide
item.description: Microsoft warns Windows 10 users face serious security risks as 90% of ransomware attacks target unsupported systems. Learn why upgrading to Windows 11 is crucial.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: China ranks last in VPN adoption globally - but it may all be smoke and mirrors
item.description: New research on VPN adoption reveals that China ranks last, but only in terms of downloads from Apple App Store and Google Play Store
item.dc:creator: Silvia Iacovcich, TechRadar

item.title: AI systems will learn bad behavior to meet performance goals, suggest researchers
item.description: There are plenty of stories out there about how politicians, sales representatives, and influencers, will exaggerate or distort the facts in order to win votes, sales, or clicks, even when they know they shouldn’t. It turns out that AI models, too, can suffer from these decidedly human failings.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: It was the hottest thing in climate tech. Now it’s trapped in the valley of death
item.description: A year ago, direct air capture—technology that pulls CO2 from the air—seemed ready to quickly scale in the U.S. Project Cypress, a massive undertaking in Louisiana designed to capture more than a million tons of CO2 each year, won $50 million in funding from the Department of Energy in early 2024.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: Canadian government claims hacktivists are attacking water and energy facilities
item.description: Businesses operating ICS systems need “effective communication and collaboration," the Canadian government warns.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: Black vultures have killed and eaten several calves on Tom Karr’s cattle ranch in southeastern Ohio, a loss he says didn't happen two decades ago.
item.dc:creator: Joshua A. Bickel And Melina Walling, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: The real reason your AI isn’t delivering ROI – and how to fix it
item.description: Over the last few years, the enterprise AI mandate has revolved around one question: “What can AI do?” That curiosity sparked a wave of pilots – creative, varied, and sometimes downright whimsical. Each offered lessons that deepened understanding of AI’s potential and limits.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Hace falta una interrupción del servicio de AWS para priorizar la diversificación
item.description: A lo largo de lo años he advertido sobre los peligros de que las empresas dependan de un pequeño grupo de proveedores de nube dominantes, como AWS, Microsoft Azure y Google Cloud Platform.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: 6 easily overlooked ways Android 16 can make your life easier
item.description: When you really stop and think about it, a new Android version is kinda like a cake: It’s filled with all sorts of different layers, textures, and toppings — and when it’s especially well-made, you find yourself encountering pleasant new nuances with every next bite.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Republicans urge Trump administration to back Falun Gong lawsuit against Cisco
item.description: Two prominent Republicans on Capitol Hill want the Supreme Court to allow a lawsuit to proceed against tech giant Cisco over allegations that the company’s technology was used to persecute members of the Falun Gong religious sect in China.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: U.S. allowed and helped firms sell tech used for China’s surveillance state
item.description: U.S. lawmakers have tried four times since September last year to close what they called a glaring loophole: China is getting around export bans on the sale of powerful American AI chips by renting them through U.S. cloud services instead.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Samsung’s third-quarter revenue soars, driven by semiconductor sales
item.description: On October 30, Samsung Electronics reported a 32.5% increase in operating profit for the third quarter, driven by rebounding demand for its computer memory chips, which the company expects will continue to grow on the back of artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: This rapid SSD moves 1GB in just seconds, and offers fingerprint security - but it'll fit right in your top pocket
item.description: This compact SSD offers rapid transfers and fingerprint access, but its limited capacity and uncertain durability curb its professional potential.
item.dc:creator: Efosa Udinmwen, TechRadar

item.title: Even the most complex and advanced business VPN tools could still leave you at risk of attack - here's how to stay safe
item.description: Organizations using on-premise Cisco, Citrix, or SonicWall VPNs are at high risk of ransomware, report claims.
item.dc:creator: Wayne Williams, TechRadar

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Adobe AI assistants let you edit images in Photoshop and Express via prompts
item.description: Adobe is developing new generative AI (genAI) assistants that let users edit images in Adobe Express and Photoshop with written prompts. Having embedded AI-based content-generation tools across its apps in recent years, Adobe is rolling out AI assistants and agents.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Nvidia becomes world’s first $5 trillion company
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company in the world to reach a $5 trillion valuation. The chipmaker’s stock jumped 3 percent at market open, pushing the company above the historic milestone.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: EPA deepens work with water sector amid rising cyber concerns
item.description: The EPA’s work to identify vulnerabilities in the water sector will be a critical piece of its efforts as the risk management agency for water utilities. The post EPA deepens work with water sector amid rising cyber concerns first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Justin Doubleday, Federal News Network

item.title: 5 social media safety tips to protect your privacy online
item.description: Kurt Knutsson's guide covers social media privacy protection through location settings, account privacy controls and two-factor authentication to prevent scams and data breaches.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: OpenAI completes restructuring, signs new agreement with Microsoft
item.description: OpenAI has completed a restructuring of the company, converting its for-profit arm into a public benefit corporation and giving its nonprofit a controlling stake, the ChatGPT maker announced Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: IT shortcuts curb AI returns
item.description: Nearly all the companies I talk to today are using AI, but most fall short when it comes to getting real value from AI, aside from a select few. Cisco calls these AI standouts the “pacesetters.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: How to vibe code for free, or almost free
item.description: Many developers haven’t yet crossed over to LLM-based code generation, whether it’s vibe coding, spec development, agentic engineering, or whatever your flavor may be. And if you’re not convinced, you’re probably not going to shell out real money for it just yet.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Meta AI edits your camera roll for better Facebook posts
item.description: Facebook's new Meta AI feature analyzes your camera roll photos to create polished collages automatically, but requires cloud processing and raises privacy concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
